page.title: 16Elderly people in Willenhall
page.content: Retired people are called Old Age Pensioners or Senior Citizens.The age of retirement is 60 for women and 65 for men.For a married couple the pension is Â£64 for a single person it is Â£36.Pensioners get free bus passes which enables them to go anywhere in the West Midlands free of charge after 9.30a.m.They are also entitled to free treatment on the National Health,which includes free prescription charges, free glasses,free dental charges etc. There are also a number of Old Peoples Homes in the area where old people can live if they are disabled or if they are not capable of looking after themselves.There are 3 of these in our area,Meadow House,Short Heath House and one in Stroud Avenue.There are also some special bungalows supervised by a warden where elderly people can live by themselves.
